description_txt: stated on May 12, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: "You’ve got almost twice as many cops in New York City as you do on our entire border. That’s nuts."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2010 in a Nevada U.S. Senate race campaign commercial:
quote_txt: "Sue Lowden gave Harry Reid's campaigns a thousand dollars in five different elections, helping his Senate dreams come true."

description_txt: stated on May 18, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Rick Scott "was forced to resign as the head of a company that pled guilty to massive amounts of systematic fraud, including 14 felonies, leading to a historic $1.7 billion fine."

description_txt: stated on April 16, 2010 in a campaign commerical:
quote_txt: Steve Poizner "increased his department's budget nearly 14 percent."

description_txt: stated on April 10, 2010 in a campaign commercial:

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2010 in a Tea Party rally in El Paso:
quote_txt: On the National Animal Identification System.

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2010 in statements to the press:
quote_txt: On returning Republican campaign contributions.

description_txt: stated on May 11, 2010 in a TV ad:

description_txt: stated on April 23, 2010 in an e-mail blast:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Rep. Lamar Smith supported the $700 billion Wall Street bailout in 2008, "but now he is standing in the way of reforms that would assure these bailouts would never happen again."

description_txt: stated on May 14, 2010 in a campaign commercial:

description_txt: stated on May 12, 2010 in an e-mail to supporters.:
quote_txt: John Mica's brother is an oil lobbyist and his daughter represents the natural gas industry.

description_txt: stated on May 15, 2010 in email:
quote_txt: "Rick Scott's even saying he wants more offshore drilling."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2010 in a column:
quote_txt: Elena Kagan "has published five scholarly review articles, mostly on administrative law and the First Amendment. These articles were mostly on technical and procedural issues."

description_txt: stated on May 13, 2010 in a meeting with the St. Petersburg Times editorial board.:
quote_txt: "I got a letter from 20 people who said they wanted their money back, 14 never gave me a penny."

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2010 in an e-mail blast.:
quote_txt: Says state's expected "increase in federal political clout is almost entirely due to the growth of the African American and Hispanic populations in Texas in virtually every region of the state.”

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2010 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Military "recruiting went on at Harvard every single day throughout the time (Kagan) was there."

description_txt: stated on May 16, 2010 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Elena Kagan "violated the law of the United States at various points" with her opposition to military recruiters.

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2010 in a Web video:
quote_txt: "Bill White used D.C. connections from his job in the Clinton administration to form a company that did business in the Middle East and defaulted on a $60 million loan."

description_txt: stated on May 3, 2010 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "The city of Houston now has more debt per capita than California."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2010 in his website:
quote_txt: Elena Kagan is "a New York City radical, Marxist lawyer through and through."

description_txt: stated on May 10, 2010 in his website:
quote_txt: "She (Kagan) took money from Goldman Sachs just like her boss, Obama."

description_txt: stated on May 5, 2010 in a broadcast of the Ed Show:
quote_txt: "Louisiana Sen. Mary Landrieu received almost $1.8 million from BP over the last decade."

description_txt: stated on April 23, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says that when he first ran for office in the late 1980s, "there were still folks who didn't have phone service. Soon I'd helped ensure that everyone in North Florida could access a dial tone."

description_txt: stated on May 4, 2010 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: "In the last 10 years we've only had 7,000 barrels of oil spilled in the Gulf ... not counting hurricanes. This well is spewing that amount every day and a half."

description_txt: stated on May 11, 2010 in an interview with MSNBC's Ed Schultz:
quote_txt: Louisiana gets "not one single penny" from Gulf Coast offshore oil revenues.

quote_txt: "Texas has, now, the highest share of minimum-wage workers in the nation."

quote_txt: On the Arizona immigration law.
